definition[0]: if something is interesting, you give it your attention because it seems unusual or exciting or provides information that you did not know about
example[2]: Did you meet any interesting people?
example[3]: It’s interesting that no one remembers seeing the car.
example[4]: I found his talk very interesting.
example[5]: It will be interesting to see what happens when he gets a bit older.
note[1]: it is interesting to see/know etc
definition[1]: keeping your attention and making you want to know more
example[6]: There’s an interesting article in the newspaper today.
example[9]: Everything about ancient Egypt is absolutely fascinating.
definition[3]: giving you new ideas or experiences in a way that is interesting and enjoyable
example[11]: I found him very stimulating to be with and full of ideas.
definition[4]: interesting because of being unusual, mysterious, or unexpected, so that you want to find out more
example[12]: Their research has produced some intriguing results.
example[13]: These discoveries raise intriguing questions about the relationship between viral genes and the normal genes of the cell.
definition[5]: interesting in a way that keeps your attention completely or for a long time
example[14]: Growing your own vegetables can be an absorbing hobby.
definition[6]: used about a very interesting story, film etc that you feel you must keep reading or watching
example[16]: a gripping story of love and death
example[17]: He gives a riveting performance as a tough street cop.
example[18]: There is something compelling about his work.
definition[7]: very interesting and exciting – used especially about a performance you are watching or listening to
example[19]: Pakistan won an enthralling match by two wickets.
definition[8]: very interesting because of being so strange, unusual, or wonderful
example[20]: The book is a spellbinding tale of her life in China.
definition[9]: used when saying that a book was so interesting that you could not stop reading it
example[21]: It’s a great book – I found that I couldn’t put it down.
